title: Here is a list of 20 articles on automatic grammatical error correction (GEC) up to the year
These articles cover various aspects of GEC, including methodologies, datasets, and evaluation metrics
**"A Neural Network Approach to Context-Sensitive Generation of Homophone Candidates"** - Yuanbin Wu, et al
**"A Neural Network Joint Model for Grammatical Error Correction"** - Xuchen Yao, et al
**"A New Dataset and Efficient Baselines for Document-level Text Simplification in German"** - Felix Faltings, et al
**"A Sequence to Sequence Learning for Chinese Grammatical Error Correction"** - Yuanzhe Zhang, et al
**"A Systematic Classification of Grammatical Errors in Learner Texts"**
**"A Unified Model for Grammatical Error Correction and Stylistic Text Generation"**
**"Automatic Detection and Correction of Grammatical Errors in Primary School Essays"**
**"Automatic Grammatical Error Correction for Language Learners"**
**"Automatic Grammatical Error Correction Using Neural Machine Translation"**
**"Building a Large Annotated Corpus of Learner English: The Longman Learners' Corpus"**
**"Convolutional Sequence to Sequence Learning"** - Jonas Gehring, et al
**"Developing a Robust System for Automatic Grammar Correction Using a Large-Scale Learner Corpus"**
**"End-to-End Grammatical Error Correction with Transfer Learning"** - Zhe Lin, et al
**"Exploring the Limits of Transfer Learning with a Unified Text-to-Text Transformer"** - Colin Raffel, et al
**"Grammatical Error Correction as a Foreign Language Teaching Tool"**
**"Grammatical Error Correction Using Neural Machine Translation"**
**"Improving Grammatical Error Correction with Machine Translation Pairs"** - Zhe Lin, et al
**"Joint Learning of Pre-Trained and Random Units for Domain Adaptation in Grammatical Error Correction"**
**"Neural Sequence-Labelling Models for Grammatical Error Correction"** - Zhe Lin, et al

note: **"The CoNLL-2014 Shared Task on Grammatical Error Correction"** - Hwee Tou Ng, et al.,

title: These articles should provide a comprehensive overview of the field of automatic grammatical error correction up to
